Review:
Anle Temple is only open for a few seasons. In addition, the 2nd of every month is the birthday of Ksitigarbha Bodhisattva - Ksitigarbha's fate day, so it is also open to the public. And there will be a small handmade market that day. There are not many stalls, but they are scattered all over the temple. The uncrowded space makes people feel comfortable and relaxed. I have to mention that there is a small cafeteria in the temple, each time it is managed by a different chef. The day I went there happened to be the vegan POP UP Cafe - Imaginary Cafe!
The ANRAKUJI Temple opens only for in some specific seasons. In addition, the 2nd of every month is the birthday of K·π£itigarbha, which is also open to the public. And there will be a small hand-made market/fair on the same day. There are not many booths, but they are scattered all over the temple. The uncrowded space makes people feel comfortable and relaxed. Author: Yasuhiro
Review:
A temple of the Jodo sect at the foot of the mountain, crossing Tatsumi Bridge on the Philosopher's Path.
South of Honen-in Temple.

The autumn foliage season is very beautiful, but I visited on November 3rd, which is still early.

In front of the temple gate, there is a stone pillar carved with the words ``Jodo Rei Sanne Motochi, Enko Daishi Sacred Site''.

According to the information board of Kyoto City in the precincts, it is as follows (summary).
Called Jurenzan, it is a temple of the Jodo sect.
At the beginning of the Kamakura period, two disciples of Honen Shonin, Sumirenbo and Anrakubo, built a training hall about one kilometer east of the present location and encouraged people to practice the nembutsu. By chance, an incident occurred in which Princesses Matsumushi and Suzumushi, court ladies of the Retired Emperor Gotoba, were educated and secretly entered into the priesthood. Heh, Shinran Shonin was exiled to Echigo.
This is the so-called Ken'ei 2nd year Buddhist persecution, but at the end of the Muromachi period, this temple was rebuilt in order to hold a memorial service for two priests.
In the main hall, the principal image of Amida Sanzon is enshrined, and beside it, there are seated statues of Juren, Anraku, Princesses Matsumushi and Suzumushi, and a statue of Honen.

It is said that there is a five-ring stone pagoda of Matsumushi and Suzumushi in the eastern mountains that can be seen in the back of the garden.

The atmosphere is very calm.
After hearing about the history of this temple at the hall, it is very relaxing to spend some time looking at the beautiful garden, the greenery of the mountains, and the flowing clouds.

Author: Áî∞‰∏≠ÂÜ¨‰∏ÄÈÉéÔºà„Çπ„ÉäÔºâ
Review:
Honen's Nenbutsu Dojo. Retired Emperor Gotoba's concubines Matsumushi and Suzumushi were inspired by the sermons of Honen's disciples Juren and Anraku, and secretly entered into the priesthood to arouse the Emperor's wrath. The temple was built in 1681 to mourn for two priests.

The wooden statues and stone pagodas of Sumiren and Anraku, Matsumushi and Suzumushi convey the tragedy. It is open to the public in spring and autumn. The Shishigaya Pumpkin Memorial Service is famous for the midsummer festival "July 25th".

Author: „ÅÇ„Å®„Çä
Review:
On July 25, 2010, I went to the Shishigaya Pumpkin Memorial Service.
I went to match the event because it is usually closed to the public.

The green maple in front of the temple gate was spectacular.

In front of the Jizo-do hall where Kusa no Jizo Bodhisattva is enshrined, there is a cute statue of a gourd-shaped Shishigaya pumpkin.
There was also a heart-shaped washbasin, which was very photogenic.
The frog in the chozuya was also cute.

After listening to the chief priest about the principal image of worship, temple treasures, and Shishigaya pumpkins at the main hall, I received some pumpkins.
It didn't feel like an event at a tourist temple, but it felt like a home away from home as I was participating in a temple event with the locals.
The pumpkin was also warm and delicious.
It is said that if you eat Shishigaya Pumpkin during the summer, you will not get paralyzed.
Also, the garden was worth seeing.

I received a red stamp.

Author: san NN
Review:
Jurenzan Anrakuji Temple, sect of Jodo sect (independent), principal image of Buddha is Amida Nyorai
The mountain name is derived from Jurenbo, a disciple of Honen Shonin, and the temple name is also derived from Anrakubo.
Famous as a temple for the "pumpkin memorial service" held in July every year.

The history of the temple begins when the two of them signed a draft in Shishigaya, east of here.
The ladies of Gotoba-in (Princess Matsumushi and Princess Suzumushi) became priests while visiting the Emperor Kumano.
Infuriated by this, Gotoba-in sentenced Juren and Anraku to death, and exiled Honen to an island.
After Honen returned to Kyoto, he revived the draft under their names in memory of them.

There is a memorial tower for two princesses in the southeast of the precincts, and a memorial tower for two priests in the south.
